title: Marks calculator app matching the provided report-card layout

requirements.text: Recreate the report-card/table layout shown in the uploaded image as the main screen of the app, keeping headings, sections, and column structure visually consistent with the image.

quotes: Create an app for me using the image in which it does the calculation itself i just enter the marks and the output should remain as provided in IMAGE

acceptanceCriteria: The UI contains a top title similar to the image (e.g., 'ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE' and 'SCHOLASTIC AREAS').

The main table contains the same column groups as the image: SUBJECTS; EXAMINATIONS (1st Unit Test, 2nd Unit Test, Total Marks); HALF YEARLY 100 Marks; ANNUAL EXAM 100 Marks; and computed columns for 20% of UT (X), 30% of HY (Y), 50% of AE (Z), and Total 100 Marks (X+Y+Z).

The UI includes the lower sections present in the image: a 'Fields' table (Half Yearly/Annual), an 'Attendance Records' box (Total Working Days/Present Days), and 'Result'/'Remarks' lines, plus signature placeholders for 'Class Teacher' and 'Principal'.

requirements.text: Provide editable inputs for entering marks per subject for: 1st Unit Test, 2nd Unit Test, Half Yearly (out of 100), and Annual Exam (out of 100). The rest of the columns must auto-calculate and render in-place in the same row.

quotes: i just enter the marks and the output should remain as provided in IMAGE

acceptanceCriteria: Each subject row has numeric inputs for 1st Unit Test, 2nd Unit Test, Half Yearly, and Annual Exam.
Inputs prevent non-numeric values and allow clearing a value.
Changing any input immediately updates the computed columns for that row without a page reload.

requirements.text: Implement the calculations shown by the table headers: (a) Total Marks under EXAMINATIONS = 1st Unit Test + 2nd Unit Test; (b) X = 20% of UT Total Marks; (c) Y = 30% of Half Yearly marks; (d) Z = 50% of Annual Exam marks; (e) Total 100 Marks = X + Y + Z.
acceptanceCriteria: For any row, UT Total Marks equals UT1 + UT2.
For any row, X equals 0.2 * (UT Total Marks).
For any row, Y equals 0.3 * (Half Yearly marks).
For any row, Z equals 0.5 * (Annual Exam marks).
For any row, Total 100 equals X+Y+Z.
Displayed computed values are consistently rounded (choose one approach and apply it everywhere, e.g., to 2 decimal places or nearest integer).

requirements.text: Include the same subject list as shown in the image as default rows: English, English II, Mathematics, Hindi, EVS, G.K., Social Studies/Science, Science, Assamese, Computer, Drawing, Conversation, Health & Physical Education; plus a 'Total' row and a 'Percentage' row.
acceptanceCriteria: All listed subjects appear as separate rows by default.
A 'Total' row sums each numeric column across subjects (including computed columns).
A 'Percentage' row computes overall percentage based on the summed 'Total 100 Marks' across subjects divided by (number_of_subjects * 100) * 100.

requirements.text: Add editing for the lower-section inputs shown in the image: (a) 'Fields' table items (Work Experience, Regularity, Punctuality, Cleanliness, Indigenous Sports, School Programmes, Visual and Performing Art) with Half Yearly and Annual entries; (b) Attendance Records: Total Working Days and Present Days; (c) Result and Remarks text entries.
acceptanceCriteria: All listed 'Fields' items are editable for both Half Yearly and Annual columns.
Attendance records allow numeric input for working days and present days.
Result and Remarks are editable text fields.
All these values render in a layout consistent with the image sections.

requirements.text: Add basic validation and inline feedback: marks should be within 0–100 for Half Yearly and Annual; Unit Test inputs should be non-negative and clearly labeled (if max is unknown, do not enforce an upper bound for UT inputs, but still prevent negatives).
acceptanceCriteria: Half Yearly and Annual inputs outside 0–100 are flagged and excluded from calculations until corrected (or clamped—pick one behavior and apply consistently).
Unit Test inputs do not allow negative values.
Validation messages are in English and do not break the table layout.

requirements.text: Provide a Print-friendly view so the filled form can be printed from the browser while keeping the output format closely matching the image (table borders, spacing, and headings retained).

quotes: the output should remain as provided in IMAGE

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Print' action triggers the browser print dialog.
The printed layout fits on typical A4/Letter with minimal clipping and preserves the form-like appearance (borders and headings visible).

requirements.text: Choose and apply a coherent visual theme that matches a paper report-card aesthetic (e.g., warm off-white background, dark gray/black text, subtle border lines), and enforce it consistently across the page.
acceptanceCriteria: The app uses a consistent, form-like theme (not blue/purple by default).
Typography and spacing feel like a printable academic form.
Inputs are styled to blend into the form while remaining clearly editable on screen.

requirements.text: Use a generated clean background form image (matching the provided layout) as a static asset and render inputs/values aligned on top of it so the on-screen output closely resembles the image.
acceptanceCriteria: A generated background image is stored under frontend/public/assets/generated and is used in the UI.
Inputs/values align to the background grid such that the overall appearance closely matches the uploaded form.
The UI remains usable on common screen sizes (at minimum: desktop widths), with horizontal scrolling allowed if necessary to preserve alignment.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Frontend must be React + TypeScript with Tailwind and compose existing UI components without editing any immutable paths.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor if used; do not introduce additional backend services.
nonGoals: Multi-student record management, user accounts, or long-term persistence across devices.
Integrations with external databases, spreadsheets, or third-party APIs.

required: Clean report-card form background with table lines and headings similar to the uploaded image, no handwritten marks, no logos (report-card-form.dim_1600x1100.png)
